item.title: North Korea tests new long-range cruise missile
item.description: It suggests the country is developing new weapons despite food shortages and an economic crisis.

item.title: British American Tobacco negotiated bribe for Mugabe, new evidence suggests
item.description: Documents reveal British American Tobacco’s role in bribery and spying in southern Africa.

item.title: Record number of environmental activists murdered
item.description: More than 220 environment and land rights activists were murdered last year, according to a report.

item.title: Raducanu: US Open champion celebrated in China for her heritage
item.description: Many in China have been quick to point out the 18-year-old's half-Chinese heritage.

item.title: Eitan Biran: Italy investigates 'kidnap' of cable car crash survivor
item.description: Eitan Biran, 6, the only survivor of May's disaster, is taken to Israel by his grandfather.

item.title: Italian Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton says 'halo' safety system saved his life in crash
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says Formula 1's 'halo' safety device saved his life in his crash at the Italian Grand Prix.

item.title: Britney Spears announces engagement to Sam Asghari
item.description: The singer, who is fighting a legal battle over her conservatorship, met fiancé Sam Asghari in 2016.

item.title: Spain fire: Thousands flee blaze near Costa del Sol town
item.description: Almost 2,000 people have left their homes as the military joins efforts to contain the flames.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban announce new rules for female students
item.description: Students will be segregated by gender and have to observe a dress code.

item.title: Match crowd catches falling cat in a flag
item.description: The cat used one of its nine lives at the American football match in Miami Gardens, Florida.

item.title: Kenyan influencers paid to take 'guerrilla warfare’ online
item.description: Shadowy financiers are closing down a once democratic space on Twitter for political debate in Kenya.

item.title: Daniil Medvedev: US Open champion finally celebrates - and says title is anniversary present for his wife
item.description: Winning his first Grand Slam at the US Open was enough for Daniil Medvedev to finally celebrate - and he pulled out a move from a video game.

item.title: Why North Korea keeps launching missiles
item.description: North Korea keeps testing missiles despite international condemnation. Why does Pyongyang persist?

item.title: India appointed three top women judges. Is it too early to celebrate?
item.description: Appointment of three women to India's Supreme Court is being hailed as a "historic moment".

item.title: Canada election: Three voters explain what matters most to them
item.description: Three people tell the BBC what issues are at stake and who they are voting for, as election day nears.

item.title: The pressures - and rewards - of being an influencer
item.description: Running your own popular YouTube channel can be lucrative, but it comes with downsides.

item.title: The first hate-crime attack after 9/11
item.description: The story of the first American to be killed in the backlash - a turbaned Sikh man in Arizona.

item.title: Families and leaders mark 20th anniversary of 9/11
item.description: Commemorations have taken place on the 20th anniversary of the 11 September attacks.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Moment of silence as families recite names of victims
item.description: On the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attack, New York City held a moment of silence for the lost 2,977 lives.

item.title: ICYMI: A big week for small things
item.description: Here's a round-up of some the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: Red carpet debut for 'Bennifer' 2.0 in Venice
item.description: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez arrive in Venice for the premiere of The Last Duel.
